title: Behavior of function defined as an integral

content.question: Let f be the function defined by <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>36</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> </mrow> </mstyle><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> </math>. On which of the following intervals is the graph of <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> concave down?

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
